messageBody:
olingaa wrote:

> To put my question in a general sense, how can TestRunner recognize
> class A that extends class B that extends TestCase as testable?

Some test runners, such the one in Eclipse 2.x, don't correctly collect
tests from a TestCase class that declares no test methods, but inherits
them from a superclass. Try adding a testDummy() {} to your test case
class and see whether the test runner finds the other tests.

I usually name this method

public void testBecauseEclipse2Sucks() {
}

I should name it

public void testBecauseTheClientWontLetTheTeamMoveOffWsad5() {
}
